Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: vesnyshka
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a family in this hotel in early January 2012. The hotel is not in the center of Madrid. But the hotel is very convenient to take a bus from the airport. As fast (20 minutes), you can take a bus directly to the Plaza Puerta de Sol. The bus stop is 100 meters away. The nearest metro station is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 10 am and we were given an early check in. Also at the reception we were given vouchers for 50 percent discount on breakfast at the hotel restaurant. Normal price 17 euros, our breakfast cost $ 8.5. euro. Very good choice for breakfast. Vegetables, cheeses, sausage. There are local specialties - tapas, tortilla, bokadilya. Good coffee. Varied and tasty desserts. You can order a la carte hot - scrambled eggs, fried eggs. The hotel rooms are good. We were given a room on the top floor with a beautiful view. Room with large windows. The beds are comfortable. In the bathroom, modern equipment. There is a shower gel, shampoo, soap. We had a standard room with an extra bed. The room is quite big, the place enough. Very good price. 60 euros for a double room with a child 13 years of age. I had dinner in the hotel's cafe. Very tasty food and a decent price. The only downside - the service is slow. The hotel staff is courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not a central location but great value for money/service”
Reviews.Author: Haagen
Reviews.Content: We wanted a quieter location which meant that in Madrid we'd be staying a bit out of town. A cab ride into touristy parts is relatively quick/inexpensive, I think there are also metro stations nearby but not in very close proximity. The hotel is quite modern/attractive and we found the staff to be very friendly and helpful on many fronts (including inquiring after hospitals when my dad was not feeling well). Rooms are basic (as are the amenities) but spacious, and the buffet breakfast very reasonably priced. Great gym on top floor!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but night staff a little unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: lorraineJLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night, arrived in from airport about midnight and not a sole was at the reception desk, even though there was CCTV in reception no-one was available. We waited for up to 15 minutes, before realizing there was a bell on the outside of the automatic doors. When he finally booked us into our room, it was the incorrect one from the booking, so we had to go back down to the reception and get another room. The best thing about hotel was the value and the breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Nothing of value but cost/benefit balance”
Reviews.Author: Stoltinger
Reviews.Content: I stayed over 2 nights for a business trip. Arriving at the hotel after a long day exhaustedly arriving at the hotel one easily can fall into deep depression. The hotel is lacking all around any atmosphere or sort of friendly and nice environment. Staff is factual and unlearned to smile- Room is pragmatic and again you feel like being prisoned even though knowing that prison must be something different. When checking out the price is showing all reasons for low level service - too cheap.

Reviews.Title: “modern, hip hotel - good value if you want to dine elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: zaplocation
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually a very good business hotel, serving the offices nearby. Close to airport (15mins or €20 taxi). Decor is like the art, minimalist hotels all around the world but done well. Free internet (one passcode for all devices). The breakfast is quite good with large selection of fruit, pastries and savories. In the evening however, they didn't have the large (breakfast) room pen and just served a poor selection of pseudo Spanish food at the end of a makeshift bar. We went right and then right again out of the hotel and found a small Spanish bar which served OK food.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy surroundings at night”
Reviews.Author: ffffriend
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in this business complex that seems to be not attracting lots of tenants. So when it is nighttime, the surrounding area looks quite abandoned and dark the overgrown grass and empty buildings. The long walk back from the subway station felt even longer than it was. There are some restaurants and groceries nearby, but if you need a nighttime snack, there is a Chinese takeout shop open til 12am and you can request the receptionist to get them to deliver to the hotel. As for the hotel itself, it is quite fashionable. The bed is big and was able to get very good sleep. Bathtub is huge as well and can comfortably accomodate two people at once. As for the TV, only available English channels were news channels. They also had that CCTV channel form China which surprised me as well. Too bad, with this kind of location, these are not compelling reasons to book a room here.

Reviews.Title: “No iron in room.... Or in entire hotel.. 10euro to have one shirt ironed. Cheap rooms but everything else costs a lot and adds i”
Reviews.Author: GNGR2012
Reviews.Content: Won't go back. Nice staff but ironing was a real problem

Reviews.Title: “Good Option for Business”
Reviews.Author: PSCLC
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent customer and I recommend it if the purpose of your stay is close to the hotel. If you want to visit the main tourist attractions of Madrid from here, I would not recommend. This hotel is very close to the airport, has decent facilities, with rooms of reasonable size. In some rooms there are starting to appear marks of the use. I've been in the restaurant for breakfast, lunch and in the bar for dinner. The food, is not outstanding, but it is served with quality and very efficient service. Closed to the hotel, 50 meters down the main street, you will find a bar / tavern / restaurant with good prices and many options. In summary, good hotel, but do not make it the base for your visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money but a bit far from the City Center”
Reviews.Author: AlexLX64
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. LOCATION: Far from the city center but conveniently located on the road from the airport ROOM: Very modern and clean rooms with a view of the city and efficient staff. TIP: Take the bus (53), it will takes you straight to the city center in 35 minutes. OVERALL: Nothing fancy, but clean & convenient for a stopover in Madrid. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good business location”
Reviews.Author: csousa84
Reviews.Content: Good location for business. Far from centre and metro. BUS very near and direct to centre. The hotel uses some low-cost materials (doors, floor, bathroom) which are getting old faster than it should.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business ,bad for tourist”
Reviews.Author: Majid M
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately i don't have any photos pf this hotel yo post it here, but I want to explain some points here. My wife and I booked this hotel via some websites. I t was a deal and didn't know anything about hotel just we know about the area.We booked the hotel with a reasonable price and looking forward for our trip to Madrid after Barcelona. First Point is that the hotel is very close to hotel ,it means you are far from the old area of town. The hotel is very modern with modern decoration in all parts with Free WIFI and fitness room in 6th floor.I can not say this is good for tourist but for business trip it is fine, Because the hotel is in residential and business district of Madrid. Despite the Location the other thins are fine such markets and restaurants around the hotel. Great Shopping mall approximately 300 meters from the hotel that make it easy to find everything you need and you don't need to go far to purchase your necessity. So let's talk about how to reach the old district such as Plaza mayor ... There are two ways: first take a bus line number 52 near the hotel and go to downtown or Walking 10 minutes and take a Metro. We didn't use the bus at all and we tried to use Metro and it was Perfect and clean with good employee and they are very polite. The most important negative point here is that if you want to go back to hotel in the middle of the day and take some rest , it is really hard to go back to hotel with Bus or Metro taking 15 to 25 minutes and go back again to down town. If we want to go back to Madrid as a tourist next time we will choose another hotel in downtown to save my time ,maybe it cost a little bit more but it worth to pay to save your time. The conclusion is the Location for tourist is not good but for business trip is good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prcoelho
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel. Spacious and adequate rooms. Nice lobby and hotel bar. Hotel restaurant is also good for lunch. The only drawback is that if you do not have business in the area, it is a bit far from the city center for sightseeing and the metro station is also probably about 1 km away. At night the area is very isolated without a lot to do.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: FrazJam
Reviews.Content: The Confortel Atrium is a superb hotel in Madrid. Situated in the business district, the closest Metro is Avenida de la Paz which is a 10 minute walk from the hotel, or the 53 bus leaves from around the corner to Sol. You don't feel like you're that far from the city centre, which we travelled into everyday. The rooms are modern and spacious. The window is massive, taking up an entire wall, from floor to ceiling. The fridge was stocked with bottled water and the towels were changed everyday. The staff were all really nice and eager to help. There are computers in the lobby which are a bit slow, but fine to quickly check for tapas restaurant ideas. Would definitely return to this hotel on future trips to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “great stay for business”
Reviews.Author: Ilse_celo
Reviews.Content: I stayed a few nights during a business trip and had everything one could wish for: cleanliness, tight sleep, good service, hot shower, and excellent breakfast. a few streets away is a very nice caffe. I suppose it is better suited for business travellers, being far from city center.

Reviews.Title: “No problem being far from Puerta Del Sol!!”
Reviews.Author: SaraGhN
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel considering the price you pay vs. the service you get. We stayed in this hotel twice in a trip we had to Spain this summer. The building, lobby and the rooms have interesting design and colors. The rooms are maintained fairly well and are clean. They put complimentary bottled water, one per day - not many but better than none. The staff at the front desk are friendly, nice and so helpful is you have any question or request. As many people mentioned, the location is a bit far from downtown and Puerta Del Sol. But as a tourist, you would have no problem as there is a bus (#53) which commutes frequently from the hotel to Puerta Del Sol and vice versa. The bus stop is in Calle de Torrelaguna, which is acually only 3 minutes walking distance! There is also a night bus coming back to the hotel, e.g. from Plaza de Cibeles. So even at night it is not a big deal to come back to the hotel. You would not have to take a taxi. There is a metro station, Arturo Soria, close to the hotel also; it is about 10-15 mins walk. I cannot tell the location would be any problem, actually it is an advantage as it gives you the opportunity to use the public transportation and view different neighborhoods of Madrid on your way to downtown or other destinations. The hotel has a fitness centre, not too many facilities but enough that keeps you exercised if you'd like to. The Wi-Fi was fine, we had no problem in terms of speed and accessibility. There is a terrace on the main floor, which is great for relaxing and enjoy the quiet neighborhood of the hotel. There are some restaurants around, again in walking distance, which would become handy. There is also a mall on the way to metro station on Arturo Soria with some cafes. There is a Opencor supermarket close by and open 24/7, which is very convenient! We stayed in Confortel Atrium-Madrid in the begining of our trip to Spain this summer. Initially we thought we would stay in another hotel at the end of our trip, but then we decided to come back to the same hotel as we liked it so much! I would highly recommend this hotel. If you tip the maid, you will receive an outstanding service for the duration of your stay. itself has

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonDors
Reviews.Content: a bit far from the city center but very modern, nice and clean rooms with a view of the city and prompt, nice staff. we had a great time. a bus (53) takes you straight to the city center in 30 minutes. good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, Good Value if You Are Willing to Be Far From Center”
Reviews.Author: Trotamundos09
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice, essentially two long weekends bookending a week's worth of travel in other parts of Spain. Found a very good deal on Orbitz. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from Avenida de Paz Metro, and the 53 and 122 buses stop at the corner. The 53 goes to Sol; the 122 goes to Avenida de Americas and the Metro and bus connections there. Rooms were large and modern, comfortable beds, flat screen TV, minibar with free bottled water. Downside was unreliable wifi. The first room I had, it worked fine; in the second, while the signal was decent, my computer said there was only a local connection with no Internet. In that case, I had to go down to the lobby to find an Internet signal. They need to upgrade their hot spot since I imagine most people who stay at this hotel will want wifi access in their rooms. They do have several desktop computers in the lobby, as well as desk/tables with easy access to power receptacles. Also, the weather was nice so one could sit out on their terrace and work there. One weekend night, there were partiers who made a lot of noise in and outside of their rooms, with little sign that the hotel staff or security cared enough to intervene. Apart from that, staff were efficient, usually multi-lingual, and provided baggage storage after checkout. Some tips: Others have mentioned the shopping center several blocks up the street; there is a large supermarket on the ground floor there, as well as a smaller Dia supermarket a block or two walking in the other direction back towards the Metro. Most of the nearby restaurants were closed on the weekend. However, if you walk across the overpass over the large Avenida de America highway, there is a cluster of stores and restaurants there including the old reliable standby, VIPs. Finally, staying in a hotel like this so far from the center, it is definitely worth getting the single- or multi-day travel card for unlimited trips.

Reviews.Title: “restaurant was closed”
Reviews.Author: gill c
Reviews.Content: Room was lovely, very dissapointed that after travalling 600 miles we found that the retaurant was closed all through august, and had to make do with bar snack which was very over priced for such a small portion and that staff were not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMountain
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, free internet & free bottles of water in the fridge! Very clean! GREAT. Local bus brings you in 25 min to Plaza Del Sol!

Reviews.Title: “Not located well for tourism”
Reviews.Author: Charlene8Seattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for WYD - it is about a 20 minute walk from the Metro Station (which is hard when it 35 degress C outside), but a inexpensive 15 Euro taxi ride to downtown Madrid. The rooms were clean and the help at the front desk was very nice and friendly. The one problem that I had with the hotel was that we added one person to the room from the two originally booked. The one additional person meant that they added at bed (cot) to the same room. They charged 35 euros a night for the cot. That seemed a little much. I was not impressed with the food at the hotel - very plain and very expensive. But there are plenty of restaurants around the hotel for meals. Like another review mentioned, the air conditioning isn't very cooling and the refridgerator doesn't chill very well. The hotel isn't anything special, but it certainly served it purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price.”
Reviews.Author: avecwithcon
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, modern and stylish decor and a great night's sleep. The location isn't the best in terms of sight-seeing and nightlife, but close to the metro and there are places to eat and shop close by. Most importantly, the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Average quality”
Reviews.Author: PatrickJ1010
Reviews.Content: I had to stay for a few days in Madrid, and choose this hotel due to it's close location with our customer. The overall quality was certainly OK, but there is room for improvement: - The aircondition is not really cooling down the room, the average temp was too high to slepp well. - The refrigerator was also not really cooling down your drinks - Quality breakfast certainly OK, but I was missing some baguette styled bread. - Bad signal quality of wi-fi in rooms, internet too slow in general, making it not so suitable for business visits... Staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: nqam
Reviews.Content: We booked Ditrikt Hotel for the second part of our honeymoon, deciding upon following reviews from Tripadvisor. The hotel did not disappoint, all of the staff, especially Alex at check in which was very late at night were courteous and helpful at all times of the day. Little gestures such as the handwritten note in our room, cupcakes, chocolate turndown service with weather, and city view with made the stay feel much more personal and welcoming. The hotel is located close to Times Square and the Port Authority, walking distance from Penn Station, so it is very conveniently located. The quality of the room is very good, a good selection of TV channels in HD and a good sized room for NY standards. the good thing in particular is that it makes the most of its size and is very cleverly thought out. We had breakfast one day and it was a good meal with a choice of various types available. The wifi was not working with our smartphones, but that was a minor compliant as there were very stylish imacs to use in the lobby on our way out in the morning with the complimentary coffee. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel without atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: gsj205
Reviews.Content: Hotel looked rather new. Designed in minimalistic style. Very cold and impersonal. However very clean, excellent wireless Internet and not least very helpful English speaking staff. Breakfast average. No minibar or option for self making of tea/coffee. But free water in the fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pikesteve
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel for a one night business stay. It took 15-20 minutes from the airport and cost around 17 euros. It is approximately a 20 euro taxi to the centre of Madrid. It was clean, comfortable with good levels of service. One plus point was that it had open plan business area with desks and internet access. Since I was visiting with business colleagues it was good for an informal chat and too prepare for our meeting. There is a shopping mall 2 streets up the one way street with a selection of restaurants on the 2nd floor, max 5 minute walk The room was clean and modern, only negative was that the TV didn't seem to be tuned in but as I was only there for the one night I didnt worry too much. The breakfast was also good with a selection of meats, pastries, fruit and drinks. A cooked breakfast is available on request, only noticed this once I had eaten everything else! I also though the level of service was good. I would definitely stay here again but I think if you are a tourist you may be better heading to somewhere a little more central.

Reviews.Title: “New modern building. Not too well located.”
Reviews.Author: travellerIndian
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights from 5th. to 7th. December 2010. Cost us 35 Euros from the Airport, but back journey was 22 Euros (after adding the airport supplement of 5.5 Euros). Later was informed that airport bus route 200 was about 15 minutes from the hotel. As it was raining on day of departure, had no option but to take taxi. Breakfast was reasonable. Bus route 53 from across the corner was 50 min. away to the city centre. Reception was manned by helpful Enrique. Not much tourist literature was available in the hotel. Not too well located for a leisure traveler. Perhaps, it suits business traveler more. At night, while coming back, always better to take the bus 53 from its starting point SOL, which was where all the action was.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: rcraft66
Reviews.Content: Close to the mall in Madrid and the office. The rooms aren't large but they are big enough. Place was clean and front desk people spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmeacheum
Reviews.Content: Great hotel close to the business office I was visiting. About a 20-30 min cab fare from the airport. Taxis in Spain do not accept credit cards so make sure you have Euros. Hotel front desk is friendly. Rooms are small but clean. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but horrific internet access knocks it down for business”
Reviews.Author: mrtourne
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 10-day stay at the Confortel Atrium, where I've actually stayed a few times over the past 18 months. Usually, I would like this hotel - but the fact that the Internet access is so poor in what is supposed to be a business hotel is something I cannot forgive. Let's start with the good. The hotel is fairly new, less than 2 years, and it's nicely designed. The lobby is very large and airy, and the rooms are well appointed - if somewhat in the "basic-scandinavian" mode of decor. I do like the bathrooms with very deep bathtubs, and the ample windows in all rooms. Even the smaller rooms are a decent size, but I'd recommend an executive room as you will get more space for very little more money. The TV service has mostly spanish channels, with very few english options (this is fairly common in Spain, sadly) and the beds are sort of hard. Also, as someone else commented, there's no iron or ironing boards - this is common in Spain, but you would expect new hotels to look at international standards and apply them... As far as common services, it has a very nice gym for a hotel in Spain - quite a few pieces of cardio equipment, free weights, nicely appointed with towels and water, etc. The bar downstairs serves some reliable if basic cafe food (sandwiches, salads, some basic entrees). The front desk personnel is nice, though not necessarily very thoroughly trained (you will get wildly different answers from different people to the same question, especially around the internet being slow) Now for the bad: The free wifi service has become really, really horrible - especially on weekdays when the hotel is full. It was ok last year when the hotel was usually emptier but now that they are full a lot of the time, it's just really bad and unusable on weeknights. Coverage is tremendously spotty with some rooms getting very low bars on wi-fi reception. On top of that, the internet connection simply cannot handle a full guest load: consistently over my stay I had the same issue over and over, where it was impossible to pull up any internet sites and would just receive server timeouts between 7 PM and midnight. When I brought this up to the staff I was told several things: that the issue was a group of guests that were tech savvy and were taking the whole bandwidth by changing router settings, that it was a temporary router issue and it would be restarted, that I needed a new ticket number because maybe it was being shared by other people. On the last day, finally, the most experienced person in the front desk admitted (with a shrug, as in "well, it is what it is and we won't do anything about it") that the connection always slows down when there's too many people on it. Again the fact that when you bring up the issue they don't take it seriously leads me to believe they will not do anything about it, like getting a bigger line like a T1 or redundant lines separated per floor. It's a shame - this hotel could be the top business hotel for the area (it has little competition nearby) but it just cannot be bothered to solve this simple issue. Considering I was trying to do some work in the evenings, this completely hampered my productivity and again makes it a place you cannot recommend for business travelers. The other issue is location - while this is convenient during the day for me due to my work location, it is really far from anything. There is one bus line outside the door that will take you downtown to Sol in about 30 minutes, and two Metro stations (Avenida de la Paz and Arturo Soria) a 15-minute walk away. But if you are the kind of person that likes something to do in the evenings right outside your door, this is not the place for you. There is a great supermarket in the Arturo Soria shopping center called Sanchez Romero (where you can stock up your little fridge) and a few nice restaurants there as well. It's two blocks away so you can ask the front desk about that Bottom line: if you are a business traveler and you depend on an internet connection to do evening work, in my opinion this hotel cannot be recommended. If on the other hand, you just unplug after a day's work and won't need a connection and are working nearby, I would say it's not a bad place to stay, especially considering the nice gym and the comfortable rooms

Reviews.Title: “defnitely NOT 4* standard”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0njb
Reviews.Content: There was very little staff and only a few spoke english. Reception desk was the worst, it usually had only one english speaker and we had to wait one hour before checking in. Room service was not 24 hours(lasted only up to 11pm). Restaurant menu was the same as room service menu which was not very extensive. They didn't have an ironing room or provide us with irionin board or iron. Walking distance from nearest tube station was 15-20 minutes. The rooms were up to the standard of a 4 star accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Alright, but would choose a different hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: tiff27
Reviews.Content: At the Confortel Atrium, I experienced great service from the staff. They spoke okay English and were very accommodating. Someone was knocking on my door various times over the course of an hour my first night there, and there were no peepholes on the door. As a woman traveling alone, I was quite nervous. When I went down to the desk, they just set me up in another room immediately after I explained. I stayed in a superior room as the price difference between standard and superior wasn't huge. The room was big, with a desk, couch, plasma tv, and huge bathroom. I was not impressed at all with the bed...it was extremely hard. So if you're a light sleeper and prefer soft beds, don't stay here. The location was alright. It was a 10-15 minute walk from the Arturio Soria metro station. It took awhile to get into the center by metro...maybe 15-30 minutes but it didn't bother me much. The hotel isn't really around much of anything...a couple restaurants and a little park. There were no vending machines/minibar in the hotel so I would bring some snacks if you tend to get hungry at times when you'd be in the hotel. The gym was small but adequate. It was not crowded at all so I wouldn't let its size dissuade you. I got the breakfast. It was good, but a bit expensive for the quality. I paid 17 euros a day and I think it was worth maybe half that. I think the service was the best aspect of my stay at this hotel and the uncomfortable beds were the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: travelguyUS
Reviews.Content: Efficient, clean , comfortable, and well priced. But if they want to delight business customers, they need to: 1) Fix their internet access - it is so slow that it is useless. and I could not get upgraded service even if I was willing to pay more. Both wireless and wired had the same issue. 2) Shut off the automated voice announcements in the elevator. We dont need to be told 5 times the door is opening in Spanish and English before getting to the 6th floor. 3) Install phones that are self explanatory - the instruments are residential class Nice to have: Better TV and channel selection for foreign travellers

Reviews.Title: “Stylish modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: dublin_boy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 1 night business trip. As it's in the north east of Madrid, it was only a 15-20 min taxi journey from the airport. The room was a good size with very modern decor and a large bathroom. WiFi access was free and reliable, once I got the code from reception, through curiously for a business-orientated hotel there were only Spanish language TV stations. Breakfast was good and staff efficient. I seemed to get lost on the way to the metro station so it took a good while to get into the city centre. Make sure bring a map of the locality or double-check directions!

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, modern hotel with great service and breakfast for a great value.”
Reviews.Author: QCATraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very modern and well designed. It had a nice fitness center and offered a wonderful continental breakfast and free wireless internet. The service was wonderful, they even made restaurant reservations for us. Our room had a mini fridge that they refilled with free water each night. It was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service, cleanliness and breakfast and spacious rooms! Free Wifi!”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTravelAR
Reviews.Content: PROS: We stayed at Confortel Atrium for 6 nights in late July of 2009. The hotel staff was wonderful, accommodating our every need. They booked us reservations at restaurants, provided us with maps and directions and were extremely accommodating at breakfast. We got the breakfast buffet as part of a package, and it was definitely worthwhile. We originally had a 3 day stay booked, but enjoyed the hotel so much that we booked three more nights. We booked through Orbitz, and this process went seamlessly. We didn’t have to check in/check out again, we just explained to them what we were doing and they gave us the same room. The hotel itself is very clean and modern. It’s a new hotel, when we looked for it on google street view, it was still under construction. There is a computer area for FREE use on the first floor as well as FREE wifi throughout the building. A terrace outside of the lobby was a good place to relax and have a drink. The breakfast area was a really nice room. Some of the seating was designed for only one person and it had personal screens where you could watch news or other tv shows of your choice. The rooms were large by European standards, as were the bathrooms. The room was very well designed, so that you could either watch TV from your couch or you could swivel the TV around so that you could watch it from your bed. This room also has a full length mirror and a safe. Every day we came home to the impeccably cleaned rooms and found several cold, *free* bottles of water in the fridge (free water in Europe!!) I used the blow dryer and it was satisfactory. The air conditioning was fantastic and our room was always cool and comfortable.. The room was pretty soundproof, we heard very little noise throughout our entire stay. The room had a small balcony overlooking Calle Emilio Vargas, but we didn’t use it much. The gym is spacious, well equipped (5 treadmills, free weights, four stationary bikes, two elipticals, other weight machines) and had a nice TV and small clean locker rooms with showers. The hotel is situated between the airport and the city center, so if you are coming from the airport it would be very convenient. The Atocha Renfe station is farther away, and you must take a half an hour metro ride to reach the Arturo Soria metro stop, plus walking from there (or you could take a cab). CON: This hotel had one drawback. We always looked forward to going back to this hotel at night. However, it was a bit of a trek back. The hotel is close ( 5 min walk or less) to a bus route (the 53) that brought us downtown to all the main sites. It IS far from the metro. We personally don’t mind walking so we frequently took the metro and walked 15 minutes home. The metro ride to the center of the city is about 20 minutes. The hotel is also hard to find if you don’t have a map. While it is a large building, most people we asked near the metro stop (which is a very very residential area) could not direct us to the stop. Make sure to have directions in advance, or at least a map and address. This hotel would be good for couples or travelers who plan to stay out and see the city all day. It would also be great for business travelers. We chose the hotel originally because we found a really incredible deal – 3 nights and breakfast for under 200 USD, which is a fantastic deal for all the amenities the hotel offers. The hotel isn’t really close enough that you can come back for a siesta, so if you want a hotel you can frequently return to during the day this is probably not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe”
Reviews.Author: frequentflying
Reviews.Content: Someone entered my room at night!!! I went to the reception and after a few minutes of mumbling they said "it must be the maintenance person". At 4 AM?! What the hell....

HotelInfo.Name: Confortel Atrium
HotelInfo.Address: Emilio Vargas, 28043 Madrid, Spain
